item.title: Portfolio
item.description:
FanLAB (made with Unreal Engine)

FanLAB is an educational simulator built with Unreal Engine, intended to introduce high school students to the use of tools and equipment from various disciplines. It features a customizable avatar controlled both in third and first person, which students use to join multiplayer sessions created by a professor to do many activities in the form of workbenches, and play with vehicles, programmed from the ground with blueprints. One of my tasks was to incorporate vehicles with a nice arcade movement and feel, from scratch into the application, as a way for students to have some fun in a sandbox manner while idle or between tasks. This particular feature was a success.
